items.title: Councils warn of 'total collapse' in special needs system
items.summary: The government is facing political pressure as it tries to reform the "broken" system of support for children with special educational needs.

items.summary: Julie Broadbent is praised for her "unique ability to connect with pupils".

items.title: University staff to strike as jobs row escalates
items.summary: Union members plan to walk out later this month over plans to cut 400 roles at Lancaster University.

items.title: Why the shake-up of school inspections risks causing new problems
items.summary: Ofsted's new 'traffic light' rating system comes into force this week - does this mark meaningful change or, as one expert puts it, 'high level tinkering'?

items.title: Why Scotland's teachers want 90 minutes back
items.summary: Scotland's teachers are preparing to vote on industrial action over workload and time spent in front of pupils.

items.summary: Skye Tucker fell from a nappy changing table at Little Clouds Nursery in Altens, Aberdeen, in January this year.

items.title: Tutoring a baby to make him an 'English gentleman' - Is it worth the money?
items.summary: The advert seeks "an extraordinary tutor" required "to support child on his first steps to becoming an English gentleman."

items.title: Can teacher shortages be solved by attracting career changers?
items.summary: The North East has seen the biggest fall in trainee teachers in England, down by 56% since 2019-20.
